lead_paragraph: The California Health Services Department named Ground Zero in Marina del Rey, Calif., to handle its tobacco education account. Billings were estimated at $125 million for the five-year contract. Colleen Stevens, chief for the media campaign at the Department of Health Services tobacco control program, said the decision came after a three-month review that was narrowed to Ground Zero and one other finalist, Dailey & Associates in West Hollywood, Calif., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies. Other participants in the review included: DGWB in Irvine, Calif. and Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco, part of the Omnicom Group.
abstract: California Health Services Department names the ad agency Ground Zero to handle its tobacco education account (S)
